```{r}
packages = c('ggstatsplot', 'tidyverse', 'corrplot','ggcorrplot')
for (p in packages){
  if(!require(p, character.only = T)){
    install.packages(p)
  }
}
```

```{r}
wine <- read_csv("data/wine_quality.csv")
```

```{r}
pairs(wine[,2:12], upper.panel = NULL )
```
```{r}
panel.cor <- function(x, y, digits=2, prefix="", cex.cor, ...) {
usr <- par("usr")
on.exit(par(usr))
par(usr = c(0, 1, 0, 1))
r <- abs(cor(x, y, use="complete.obs"))
txt <- format(c(r, 0.123456789), digits=digits)[1]
txt <- paste(prefix, txt, sep="")
if(missing(cex.cor)) cex.cor <- 0.8/strwidth(txt)
text(0.5, 0.5, txt, cex = cex.cor * (1 + r) / 2)
}

pairs(wine[,2:12], 
      upper.panel = panel.cor)
```

Create correlation plot
Default statistical method: Pearsons

```{r}
ggstatsplot::ggcorrmat(
  data = wine, 
  cor.vars = 1:11,
  ggcorrplot.args = list(outline.color = "black", 
                         hc.order = TRUE,
                         tl.cex = 10),
  title    = "Correlogram for wine dataset",
  subtitle = "Four pairs are no significant at p < 0.05"
)
```

Corrplot

```{r}
wine.cor <- cor(wine[, 2:11])
```

```{r}
corrplot(wine.cor)
```

```{r}
corrplot.mixed(wine.cor, 
               lower = "ellipse", 
               upper = "number",
               tl.pos = "lt",
               diag = "l",
               tl.col = "black")
```

Corrplot w sig test

```{r}
wine.sig = cor.mtest(wine.cor, conf.level= .95)
corrplot(wine.cor,
         method = "number",
         type = "lower",
         diag = FALSE,
         tl.col = "black",
         tl.srt = 45,
         p.mat = wine.sig$p,
         sig.level = .05)
```

Corrplot allows us to reorder the arguements to change the visualization

Method 1: Order
```{r}
corrplot.mixed(wine.cor, 
               lower = "ellipse", 
               upper = "number",
               tl.pos = "lt",
               diag = "l",
               order="AOE",
               tl.col = "black")
```
Hierachical Clustering
addrect is for the number of clusters
```{r}
corrplot(wine.cor, 
         method = "ellipse", 
         tl.pos = "lt",
         tl.col = "black",
         order="hclust",
         hclust.method = "ward.D",
         addrect = 3)
```
